intro: Mentha longifolia var. pellita, commonly known as narrow-leaf mint, is a variant of the broad-leaf mint species native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and a strong, aromatic scent reminiscent of peppermint. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pale blue or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variety is often used in herbal teas and as a culinary herb due to its refreshing flavor and medicinal properties.
